author: ajsutton
content: Teku's networking has mostly been updated to v0.11.1 standard (few loose ends to deal with but enough to pull blocks). It worked with both the Topaz and Schlesi testnet.  ðŸŽ‰

author: ajsutton
content: Sadly on both testnets it considered block 64 invalid. ðŸ˜¦ I smell an epoch processing bug (apparently not exactly the same as the one Prysm had).

author: nishant0
content: Oh no ðŸ˜¦ , do you have an idea of what the bug is ?

author: ajsutton
content: Interestingly though, when trying to run the transition with zcli for Schlesi it fails with "panic: empty committee" reading in even the original genesis state.

author: ajsutton
content: lcli and teku both are fine with the genesis and lcli proceses the block that teku rejects fine.

author: ajsutton
content: Beyond that, I'm just starting to dig into what the difference might be.

author: nishant0
content: I think zcli does some pre-state verification, which is why it fails. As far as i know the other clients don't do that

author: nishant0
content: do you have the block + pre-state for where it fails ? i could help debug on prysm's side

author: ajsutton
content: I do, let me find somewhere to make it available.

author: ajsutton
content: https://github.com/ajsutton/eth2-states/tree/master/schlesi-64-invalid has Teku's pre state and the block we were trying to update (pre state should have matched what everyone else had)

content: if you could put teku's post-state it would be helpful. I could diff it too

content: We don't yet capture the state when we reject the block, but I'm about to change that.

content: no prob, sounds good

author: ajsutton

author: ajsutton
content: Looks like we're awarding exactly half the reward we should have.

author: ajsutton
content: Bingo found it.  We're doing an `=` instead of a `+=` as part of `get_attestation_deltas`.  Hard to spot in the java translation's verbosity.

author: ajsutton
content: And we're off:

author: ajsutton
content:
```2020-05-01 15:03:54.405+10:00 | TimeTickChannel-0 | INFO  | teku-event-log | Slot Event *** Current slot: 27319, Head block: 65, Justified epoch: 0, Finalized epoch: 0, Finalized root: 0xc9cb..db82
2020-05-01 15:04:00.372+10:00 | TimeTickChannel-0 | INFO  | teku-event-log | Sync Event *** Current slot: 27320, Head block: 109, Connected peers: 2
2020-05-01 15:04:13.355+10:00 | TimeTickChannel-0 | INFO  | teku-event-log | Sync Event *** Current slot: 27321, Head block: 160, Connected peers: 2```

author: nishant0
content: Awesome ðŸŽ‰

author: ajsutton
content: I'm quite surprised the reference tests didn't catch that.

author: paulhauner
content:
> Bingo found it.  We're doing an `=` instead of a `+=` as part of `get_attestation_deltas`.  Hard to spot in the java translation's verbosity.
<@!340345049063882753> The spec had a very similar problem too. `=` instead of `+=`.

author: ajsutton
content: oh, so maybe we implemented it very precisely and didn't spot the fix then.

author: paulhauner
content: https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-specs/pull/1680

author: paulhauner
content: Looks like it
